page.title: 06Customs in Llangunllo
page.content:
After a local wedding children or youths stretch a ribbon or tape across the road outside the churchyard preventing the couple from leaving until the bridegroom pays for the tape to be lifted.
For disorders such as broken bones, sprains, bad backs etc. some of the older residents still prefer to consult 'bone setters' rather than resort to conventional medecine.Such 'bone setters', who also pursue some normal calling like farming, have no professional qualifications;but they are usually members of long established bone setting families and thier powers seem to be hereditary.
